title: 110_hr4848
content: Section 1 amends various acts by changing the year from 2007 to 2008. Section 2 involves including Medicare providers and suppliers in a federal payment levy and administrative offset program. Section 1 amends various acts by changing the year from 2007 to 2008. Section 2 involves including Medicare providers and suppliers in a federal payment levy program, ensuring a gradual increase in processing payments through the program over the next two years. The amendment involves including Medicare providers and suppliers in a federal payment levy program, with all payments processed through the program by September 30, 2011. Financial Management Service and the Internal Revenue Service will assist in ensuring timely inclusion of payments in the program. The amendment includes Medicare providers and suppliers in a federal payment levy program, with payments processed through the program by September 30, 2011. The effective date for the amendments made by this section shall be the date of the enactment of this Act. SEC. 3. DEPOSIT OF EXCESS SAVINGS IN PAQI FUND. Funds allocated to the Physician Assistance and Quality Initiative Fund are as follows: $93 million for 2009 and beyond, $212 million for 2014 and beyond, and $44 million for 2018 and beyond. The Secretary of Health and Human Services is responsible for ensuring these funds are used for physician services as specified. The Physician Assistance and Quality Initiative Fund allocates funds for physician services starting in 2014 and 2018. SEC. 4. PROTECTION OF SOCIAL SECURITY. The Secretary of the Treasury shall transfer specified amounts from the general revenues to the Social Security trust funds for fiscal years 2008, 2009, and 2010 to prevent reduction of assets.
